slokas: श्रीभगवानुवाचअभयं सत्त्वसंश‍ुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति: ।दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥ १ ॥
slokas_translated: The Lord said: "Fearlessness, purity of heart, steadiness in the practice of knowledge and yoga, charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness."

slokas: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्याग: शान्तिरपैश‍ुनम् ।दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्‍त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥ २ ॥
slokas_translated: "Nonviolence, truthfulness, freedom from anger, renunciation, peacefulness, freedom from backbiting, compassion for all beings, freedom from greed, gentleness, modesty, and steadiness."

slokas: तेज: क्षमा धृति: शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता ।भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥ ३ ॥
slokas_translated: "O descendant of Bharata, these qualities constitute the divine wealth of one who is born into the divine nature: radiance, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, freedom from enmity, and freedom from pride."

slokas: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोध: पारुष्यमेव च ।अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदमासुरीम् ॥ ४ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Partha, pride, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance constitute the demoniac wealth of those who are born into the demoniac nature."

slokas: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता ।मा श‍ुच: सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥ ५ ॥
slokas_translated: “The divine qualities lead to liberation, and the demoniac qualities lead to bondage. Don’t grieve, O Pandava, for you are born into the divine nature."

slokas: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च ।दैवो विस्तरश: प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे श‍ृणु ॥ ६ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Partha, in this world there are two kinds of creations: the divine and the demoniac. The divine creation has been described in detail. Now listen to the description of the demoniac."

slokas: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुरा: ।न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥ ७ ॥
slokas_translated: “The demoniac people do not know the principles of activity and renunciation. They have no understanding of purity, good conduct, or truthfulness.”

slokas: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् ।अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥ ८ ॥
slokas_translated: "They say that this world is without truth, without foundation, without a controller, without a purpose, arising from mutual contact, and without a cause other than desire."

slokas: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धय: ।प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माण: क्षयाय जगतोऽहिता: ॥ ९ ॥
slokas_translated: “Holding fast to this view, with their souls destroyed and their intelligence limited, they perform wicked deeds, which cause destruction to the world.”

slokas: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विता: ।मोहाद्‍गृहीत्वासद्‍ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽश‍ुचिव्रता: ॥ १० ॥
slokas_translated: “Driven by insatiable desire, filled with pride and arrogance, bewildered by delusion, they accept as real that which is false.  Their conduct is impure.”

slokas: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिता: ।कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिता: ॥ ११ ॥
slokas_translated: “They take refuge in endless anxiety, which ends in destruction.  Their aim is enjoyment of the senses, and this is their conviction.”

slokas: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धा: कामक्रोधपरायणा: ।ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥ १२ ॥
slokas_translated: “Bound by hundreds of ropes of desire, engrossed in lust and anger, they seek wealth and enjoyments by means of injustice.”

slokas: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् ।इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्  ॥ १३ ॥
slokas_translated: " ‘This I have acquired today, this I will obtain.  This is mine, and I will gain even more wealth.’"

slokas: असौ मया हत: शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ।ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥ १४ ॥
slokas_translated: “This enemy has been slain by me, and I will also kill others.  I am the Lord, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, I am powerful, I am happy.”

slokas: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया ।यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिता: ॥ १५ ॥
slokas_translated: “I am wealthy, I am of high birth.  Who is equal to me? I will sacrifice, I will give, I will enjoy.’ Thus deluded by ignorance.”

slokas: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृता: ।प्रसक्ता: कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽश‍ुचौ ॥ १६ ॥
slokas_translated: "Bewildered by many thoughts, covered by the net of illusion, attached to the enjoyment of the senses, they fall into a foul hell."

slokas: आत्मसम्भाविता: स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विता: ।यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ १७ ॥
slokas_translated: “Self-conceited, arrogant, and puffed up with wealth and pride, they perform sacrifices in name only, out of hypocrisy, without following the rules.”

slokas: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिता: ।मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयका: ॥ १८ ॥
slokas_translated: "They are attached to ego, strength, pride, lust, and anger. They hate Me, who dwells in the bodies of all beings, and they are envious."

slokas: तानहं द्विषत: क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् ।क्षिपाम्यजस्रमश‍ुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥ १९ ॥
slokas_translated: “Those cruel, wicked low-born men, I continually throw into the wombs of demoniac beings, birth after birth."

slokas: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि ।मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ॥ २० ॥
slokas_translated: “Born again and again in demonic wombs, those fools, O Kunti’s son, never attain to Me, but go to the lowest state.”

slokas: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मन: ।काम: क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्‍त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥ २१ ॥
slokas_translated: "Lust, anger, and greed are the three gates to hell, which destroy the self. Therefore, one should abandon these three."

slokas: एतैर्विमुक्त: कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नर: ।आचरत्यात्मन: श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ २२ ॥
slokas_translated: "O Kunti's son, the man who is liberated from these three gates of darkness, who performs actions for his own benefit, attains the supreme state."

slokas: य: शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारत: ।न स सिद्धिमवाप्‍नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥ २३ ॥
slokas_translated: "He who, abandoning the injunctions of the scriptures, acts according to his own desires, does not attain perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme state."

slokas: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ।ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥ २४ ॥
slokas_translated: "Therefore, the scriptures are your authority in determining what should be done and what should not be done. Knowing what is said in the scriptures, you should act accordingly."
